column4: Is there an easy way to remove any packages that came from no-longer-configured repos in /etc/apt/sources.list?
Under synaptic those are collected under "local or obsolete" packages
This is on a server, so cli-only :)
Aptitude might be able to show you something similar in the UI.  Or you could search through all of your packages with apt-cache policy and grep out the ones that aren't available on a server
